Detailed Description

PointF holds two float coordinates. 

 //create PointF object and initialize with assigned coordinates.
 PointF *ptf1 = new PointF(5.0, 5.0);
 //create PointF object and assigned coordinates by set() function.
 PointF *ptf2 = new PointF();
 ptf2->set(1.5, 1.5);
 //test if point is equal to assigned coordinates.
 ptf1->equals(3.0, 3.0);
 //negate coordinates
 ptf2->negate();        //ptf2 now is (-1.5,-1.5)
 //get euclidian length from assigned coordinates by length() function
 ptf1->length(10.0, 10.0);
